data.title: Great mexican food and tequila
data.text: Great place to meet friends for a drink and some good food. The mexican fare is mild, but good. There is a great tequila flight.

data.title: Average Meal, Great Ambience
data.text: The salad was drenched in dressing,  the carnitas with rice and black beans lacked spice, and the key lime pie was ok.  Great for drinks and bar food but would not recommend for dinner.

data.title: Always a good time and great food
data.text: The service is always consistent, quick and friendly. The chips are delicious and the daily specials are always interesting and fresh. The Baja Tacos were amazing. They have drink specials and promotions throughout the month so make sure to review their specials. It's ALWAYS busy and they do not take reservations. During the warmer months they have an outdoor deck, but it's in a peculiar place it seems in the back near the parking lot.

data.title: Good atmosphere, bad services
data.text:
My brother and I go to the Redmond location for drinks sometimes. This time we went during happy hour but found they only have happy hour on food, not drinks. I paid $8 for a glass of wine and it was a huge pour! So good value for money there. We also ordered some $5 nachos which I have to say are the best nachos I have ever had. 

The service in here is so bad though. Sometimes it takes forever to even be acknowledged, even if you sit at the bar!

data.title: Adult Only Mexican Restaurant
data.text: Great place for not so ordinary Mexican food, and just as great of an atmosphere. Great places for singles, or couples to mingle with friends or just have a date night.  I love getting a different drink every time I come here, because they are all so good. Can be a very popular place, just remember they don't take reservations!

data.title: Good food, great atmosphere
data.text: Went to the Matador for a group dinner/gathering. Great service, very attentive. Wide selection of food and drinks.

data.title: Not Your Every Day Mexican Food
data.text: Another downtown Redmond core restaurant that has been an anchor at the corner of Leary Way and Cleveland Avenue for a number of years now. I've eaten there several times over the last few years as well as the one in Ballard. I find the food to be excellent and an especially good value for the appys at happy hour. They carry a fine selection of tequilas if that appeals and offer tequila "family" flights. Tuesday is Top Shelf Tuesday with high end tequilas, think Chamucos Anejo (highly recommended), for $6. I love the vibe and the décor...very reminiscent of some high-end restaurants in Los Cabos. Bottom line is you can't go wrong here.

data.title: Meat galore
data.text:
If you are really hungry, this place will get rid of your cravings..
Good burgers, might be a bit busy.

data.title: Yummy Mexican
data.text: I have eaten here a few times, the MEican food is awesome.  Lots of great spicy food, but no kids.  For some reason they ahve this place listed as a bar so kids cannot eat here.  Too bad.

data.title: Do not order the Carnitas
data.text: We came for an early Sunday dinner. The wife ordered the Chicken Fajitas which was fine with a good assortment of accompaniments. But I ordered the Carnitas whi h were bland with no flavor and fatty. A real waste, service was only fair with no one checking on our order. Downtown Redmond has really developed and there are better options.

data.title: Wonderfully spicy
data.text: You must try the stuffed Jalapeños they are truly brilliant! Just love their food and unique dishes. I will come back again and a again.  I finished with coconut ice cream--yummy.

data.title: Great bar area
data.text: Stopped by on a recent visit to Redmond and checked this place out. Sat at the bar, which had great service and patrons. Cool location and decor. Food was great and I happen to hit it on 1/2 price Tequila day, so I indulged in some Casa Noble Anejo to go with my Negra Modelo Michelada. Perfection.

data.title: Lighthearted and Friendly
data.text:
I visited The Matador with business colleagues. I'm diabetic and so avoid processed carbohydrates like the plague but the Taco Salad (without those high glycaemic carb products) was delicious; I had mine with chicken. They have an amazing bar with a wide selection of booze on offer.
It's a friendly and lighthearted place to enjoy food with friends and colleagues.

owner_response.author: OpperMelang2015, General Manager at The Matador, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
OldVillain,

I appreciate the kind words. Most people don't realize that we make everything from scratch, so we can accommodate most health concerns. Feel free to stop by again and we can whip up something else from scratch for you to enjoy!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Delicious food
data.text:
We went to this restaurant for a quick dinner.  They were very busy but they managed to seat us efficiently.
The food was very tasty and plentiful.
I'd definitely go there again.

owner_response.author: OpperMelang2015, General Manager at The Matador, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Barbara,

I always appreciate a kind word, thank you!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great place
data.text: I have visited here often with coworkers. Great food selection and always a good place to unwind after work gets busy early, but worth a short wait

data.title: Good fresh Mexican cuisine with lot's of Tequila to choose from!
data.text: Upscale Mexican restaurant that won't break your budget with a fairly extensive menu of good tequila to taste - not just dump in a Margarita... which aren't bad either.

data.title: OK food, Hot wait staff
data.text: Everything is better when you get waited on by their gorgeous staff. Have been here for lunch and for dinner and drinks. The food is OK, we had the grande nachos for dinner with shredded chicken. I thought it was a little dry and asking for more salsa became an issue. Drinks were as expected, nothing special.  Had the street tacos for lunch. They were average.

owner_response.author: OpperMelang2015, General Manager at The Matador, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
David,

I apologize about the nachos. If there is ever a problem with your meal, please let us know. We will correct it on the spot. The next time you are in, please ask for me and I will make sure that your nachos are perfect, and on the house!

Thank you,
Jesse Duncan
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Bad All Around
data.text: This used to be a great place. We brought 4 friends there hoping for a fun evening and had anything but. The service was horrendous. Slow and disorganized, capped by an attitude on the part of the staff that was apathetic at best. The food is average, margaritas equally so. That's my last visit to a place that once was a regular go-to.

data.title: Disappointment.
data.text: We have been wanting to visit Matador for ages.  So after dinner we finally decided to go for drinks, on Saturday night around 10ish.  There was a long queue, almost out the door, for tables.  So we decided to sit at one of the long bar style tables in the middle.  The only free seats were on the edge with a pillar through the middle, not great.  The place had no vibe, it felt dull and dreary.  Staff were also pretty useless, we ordered a mojito and a white sangria, which were pretty pricy at $8.50 each.  My partners mojito arrived quickly, mine took 20 min.  I almost gave up on it.  Staff were disorganised and not friendly.  I wouldn't return here, drinks were so so and in my opinion they need better management.

owner_response.author: OpperMelang2015, General Manager at The Matador, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello,

I would like to apologize for your recent dining experience with us. We took your concerns to heart and have placed more staff later in the evening to make sure that the level of service during the day is the same as late night. No one should have a sub par experience just because it is later in the evening. If you could contact me at jesse@matadorrestaurants.com, I would love to take care of your next meal to show you how things here should be.

Thank you,
Jesse Duncan
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Delicious luncheon spot!
data.text: We grabbed lunch here, it was crowded, but we could sit at the bar. There are no children allowed here, so its a treat for parents to visit. Very high quality Mexican food. The bacon-wrapped stuffed jalepenos were great!
